newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania central bank one-week rate slips to 50 pct.
newsitem.headline: Romania central bank one-week rate slips to 50 pct.

text.p: The National Bank of Romania (BNR) said on Thursday it had cut the minimum permitted rate on its one-week refinancing funds to 50 percent from last week's 53 percent.
It also increased the amount on offer to 940 billion lei from 700 billion in a previous session.

Dealers said short-term money market rates were at some 51-52 percent, up from some 49 percent in early trading, as some players were looking for leu funds to build up in advance their minimum reserves and avoid end-month shortages.
Most operators said they did not expect the money market to react to the slash in the BNR's minimum permitted rate.
